name: 蘇莉芸
objective: Following the progress of the course of chemistry, introduce chemical engineering students to learn basically operations and techniques for several kinds of devices in the laboratory experiments. This course is designed to train students how to use their brain and hands simultaneously and to settle down their science concepts.
schedule:
Week	Date	                Laboratory Schedule
1	Sep. 8 – Sep. 12	Laboratory rules, group assignment
2	Sep. 15 – Sep. 19	Safety orientation
3	Sep. 22 – Sep. 26	Basic laboratory operations
4	Sep. 29 – Oct. 3	Holiday week (Teachers’ Day make-up holiday on Sep. 29)
5	Oct. 6 – Oct. 10	Holiday week (Mid-Autumn Festival on Oct. 6 and National Day on Oct. 10)
6	Oct. 13 – Oct. 17	Experiment 1: Determination of Density
7	Oct. 20 – Oct. 24	Experiment 2: Preparation of Detergent and Analysis of Its Properties
8	Oct. 27 – Oct. 31	Experiment 3: Interfacial Polycondensation – Synthesis of Nylon 66
9	Nov. 3 – Nov. 7	Experiment 4: Paper Chromatography – Separation of Metal Ions
10	Nov. 10 – Nov. 14	Experiment 5: Measurement of the Molar Volume of Nitrogen Gas
11	Nov. 17 – Nov. 21	Experiment 6: Determination of Molecular Weight Using Vapor Density
12	Nov. 24 – Nov. 28	Experiment 7: Hydrolysis Reaction and Acid–Base Titration

18	Jan. 5 – Jan. 9	Final examination week
scorePolicy:
1. Final exams weigh 20%, general performance weighs 40%, and reports weigh 40%.
2. Each late arrival will result in a 2-point deduction from the general performance score, and each absence will result in a 10-point deduction from the general performance score.
3. Each speech will result in an additional 1 point being added to the general performance score.
consultation: Please contact the course instructor and teaching assistant directly
